alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 4:55PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Bell, Clay, Knox, Leslie and Perry. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 454 PM EDT, the public reported flooding in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rounds of showers and storms are expected through the evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hazard, Barbourville, Hyden, Vicco, Spring Creek, Creekville, Roark, Marcum, Queendale, Essie, Skidmore, Bobs Fork, Ashers Fork, Bear Branch, Gardner, Hosea, Big Creek, Peabody, Warbranch and Asher. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
